item.title: "I knew you'd say that"

summary.__text:
Episode 0.9.24.
A short one this month. We talk about:
- The slow demise of Flash
- How to approach the onboarding of junior team members
- Apple Music, Last.fm and Shazam

item.title: "Cannibal Corpse being played on a harpsichord"

summary.__text:
Episode 0.9.23.
Topics include Apple's open sourcing of Swift, Pixel Art, the difference between software engineers and computer scientists, hero programmers, and abstraction vs leverage.
Links:
- http://www.dinofarmgames.com/a-pixel-artist-renounces-pixel-art/
- http://dannorth.net/2011/01/11/programming-is-not-a-craft/
- https://www.theapproachablegeek.co.uk/blog/geek-hero-syndrome/
- http://thinkrelevance.com/blog/2013/04/04/abstraction-or-leverage

item.title: "Not without a blender"

summary.__text:
Episode 0.9.22!
As the UK General Election draws to a close, Gav and Craig discuss:
- TDD and ECMAScript shims
- Coping with a lack of productivity
- How progress bars work
- JavaScript in iOS apps
- Recruiting and recruiters
- Tech talk tales and Unified Diff happenings
The blog post referenced in the discussion on recruitment companies is http://leftontheweb.com/blog/2015/04/18/Finding_a_job_without_a_recruiter/

subtitle.__text:
Episode 0.9.22!
As the UK General Election draw…

item.title: "I remember eating three packs of Dolly Mixtures"

summary.__text:
Episode 0.9.21!
The show returns after a hiatus enforced by Christmas, marriage, and audio catastrophe. Our topics are:
- Slayer wine (http://www.slayer-drinks-shop.com)
- The decline of Google Search
- An interesting new hiring strategy(https://medium.com/backchannel/the-way-we-hire-is-all-wrong-3e19e2051f3e)
- Silly interview questions (http://www.theguardian.com/money/work-blog/2015/mar/18/the-10-toughest-interview-questions)
- Using libraries.io to find and keep track of our libraries (http://libraries.io)
- Static site generators
- The pros and cons of 'Release early, release often'

subtitle.__text:
Episode 0.9.21!
The show returns after a hiatus …

item.title: "Don’t hack my computer and play Barbie Girl"

summary.__text:
Episode 0.9.18
Gav and Craig discuss: MongoDB; ephemeral, immutable infrastructure; chat and Slack; Flickr and Stuart Butterfield; the dangers of feature flags; debugging in live environments; meetup organisation tips; developer Stockholm Syndrome.

item.title: "That must interfere with your squats"

summary.__text: Episode 0.9.17! We're talking about iPads, security and the Yo! app; WYSIWYGs; component based architectures; what makes the ideal Pull Request, and the practicality of Twitter conversations. Two awful jokes are thrown in for good measure.

item.title: "If Batman's got it he needs to open source it, right?"

summary.__text:
Episode 0.9.16! Gav and Craig talk about...
- The World Cup, open source data, and technology in general in the realm of sport
- The pros and cons of being a sole developer
- Novel ways to help debug application issues
- Accessibility support, and the lack thereof
- A look ahead to various Cardiff meetups, including June's Unified Diff
